getSTDOUT

getSTDIN

public abstract java.io.OutputStream getSTDIN()

close

public abstract void close(ConsoleManager cm,
                           boolean force)
KILLs process

Parameters:
cm - TODO
force - - on Windows, if the process crashed and Windows Error Reporting(WER) is enabled (default=enabled), then a WER Popup dialog will block the process from being killed. set force=true if the process needs to be killed even in this situation (normally process should be left running/crashed so user can debug it) if false, even on Windows will still KILL the process.

close

public void close(ConsoleManager cm)
KILLs process. Note: on Windows, if process crashed and Windows Error Reporting(WER) is enabled (default=enabled) a WER Popup dialog box will appear and block the process from exiting AND block the process from being killed

See Also:
close(ConsoleManager, boolean)

isRunning

public abstract boolean isRunning()

isTimedOut

public abstract boolean isTimedOut()

isCrashed

public boolean isCrashed()
returns if process crashed. if debugger was attached to process and debugger closed, then process did not crash.

Returns:

isCrashedOrDebuggedAndClosed

public boolean isCrashedOrDebuggedAndClosed()
returns if process crashed or if debugger was attached and then closed.

Returns:
See Also:
- normally you'll check this. both #isCrashed and #isCrashedOrDebuggedAndClosed exist to ignore or detect the special case (where a debugger was attached to a process and then closed, which may cause the process to return a special non-zero exit code).

isCrashedAndDebugged

public boolean isCrashedAndDebugged()

immediately returns the output the process has returned (if process is still running, it may return more output after this call)
